intro: Saccoloma cicutarioides, commonly known as the false hogweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its roots and stems contain toxic compounds, making it potentially harmful to livestock and humans. Despite its toxicity, it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat for various insects and small animals.
